clues.text: Keep your nose clean at sea or enter this 4-letter onboard jail
Yes, sir! A 2 striper is one of these naval officers
Skivvies are these; what, you don't like hearts?

For sailors cooped up at sea for months, this type of furlough away from the ship is an important break
12th c. Andalusian writer Ibn Tufayl wrote what's been called the first novel in this language, not Spanish
The Inuit build new words by adding to existing ones; that may be why legend says their language has 50+ words for this
The ASL alphabet uses one hand; that of BSL, short for this, uses 2
Reporter Vladimir Duthiers has translated French & the language called Haitian this for Anderson Cooper
2-word term for the language of the c. 990 poem "The Battle of Maldon", about a Viking-Saxon clash
The medieval city of Carcassonne in France puts on a great fireworks display on this July holiday
With more than 60 active geysers, Chile's El Tatio in these mountains is the largest geyser field south of the Equator
Neuschwanstein Castle was begun in 1869 by "Mad" King Ludwig of this German kingdom
Dunn's River Falls makes Ocho Rios a popular destination on this Caribbean isle
The name of this Tokyo district of expensive shops means "silver mint", as a mint stood there centuries ago
Deborah in Hebrew & Melissa in Greek both translate as this insect important to farming
A Hemsworth brother & a Gallagher brother know this Gaelic form is the last 4 letters of the name in English
From Greek, this male first name means "Messiah-bearer"
A patron saint of Italy has this first name that means someone from a country next to Italy
This first name shared by several popes & 3 Russian emperors comes from the Greek for "defender of men"
"The Rise & Fall of" these creatures that ruled Earth for 150 mil. years says a new species is discovered every week
In "Inseparable", about these 19th c. twins, we learn the 4" band that joined them stretched to a freeing 6" late in life
Michael Pollan's "How to Change Your Mind" sees therapeutic value in psilocybin, the active ingredient in "magic" these
"The Soul of America" by Jon Meacham has the Lincoln-inspired subtitle "The Battle for Our Better" these
This humorist's book "Calypso" is partly about his beach house "The Sea Section", which just edged out "Canker Shores"
The name of a fertile place in the Libyan desert gives us this word for a fertile place in any desert
In 1640 English settlers named a Connecticut town "New" this, reflecting the safety it provided
Gov. Jerry Brown signed a law making California this type of state protective of immigrants
Samuel Johnson said, "Patriotism is the last" one of these "of a scoundrel"
clues.response: the last refuge of a scoundrel

clues.text: The extra-territorial type of this is granted in embassies, as to Julian Assange in the Ecuadorian one
In a double one of these weather phenomena, the colors in the secondary one are reversed
DTB is short for depth to this, the solid stuff underlying looser soil
The drift of 60,000 Nikes lost from a container ship helped establish that the California one flows into the N. Equatorial one
Standard this measurement is 1,013 millibars at sea level; in a 2007 Texas tornado, a 194-millibar drop was recorded
It's the quality of Earth's axis that gives us seasons & in geometry it means neither parallel nor perpendicular
Be sure to tip these folks who park your car for you at a restaurant

Job of Roberto Cavalli; it comes before "jeans" that are not to be worn while pitching hay
If you need a passport quickly, pay the State Department for this rush processing, meaning sped up
In this type of medicine named for a helpful hotel employee, you pay a fee for personal attention on top of your insurance

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will have only one "I" as its vowel.)

The Life magazine article "The Boys in the Bank"

rounds.text: The catalog of MoMA's first exhibition called this artist who died in 1891 a "man of science" & "inventor of a method"
